item.title: Please post feedback for improving the daily.dev algorithm in replies. Be as specific as possible and include examples üôå
item.author: Nimrod Kramer

item.title: Transparency
item.description:
I share everything I know with my team. Even when it‚Äôs half-baked. Even when I have more questions than answers. Because the worst thing a founder can do is assume their team won‚Äôt understand or can‚Äôt handle uncertainty. That‚Äôs not leadership. That‚Äôs insecurity.


People always see through the gaps. They notice the hesitation, the missing pieces, the unspoken doubts. Pretending otherwise doesn‚Äôt protect anyone, it just erodes trust. And once trust is gone, good luck getting real alignment or urgency when you actually need it.


Transparency isn‚Äôt just about honesty, it‚Äôs about unlocking collective intelligence. When uncertainty is out in the open, it stops being paralyzing. It becomes a problem that multiple smart people can attack from different angles. That‚Äôs how you move faster, not by waiting until everything is polished and ‚Äúready.‚Äù


Founders who keep information to themselves out of fear slow their own teams down. They create silos of doubt instead of a culture of action. I‚Äôd rather share the messy version early, because I trust my team to help make it better. And if you don‚Äôt trust your people to handle reality, you‚Äôve probably already lost.
item.author: Nimrod Kramer

item.title: AI and stupidity, simplified
item.description:
There are 4 types of people:



  1. Smart + Driven

  2. Smart + Lazy

  3. Dumb + Lazy

  4. Dumb + Driven


AI is a force multiplier for everyone but when it supercharges the last group, it turns into a ticking time bomb for organizations.
item.author: Nimrod Kramer

item.title: Reputation points matter more than ever in 2025
item.description:
Starting in 2025, your reputation on daily.dev will directly impact your reach and visibility.


Until now, reputation has been a measure of trust and contributions in the community, unlocking key privileges along the way. But we‚Äôre taking it a step further - higher reputation now increases the chances of your content being seen by more developers.


What‚Äôs changing?



  • Posts from high-reputation users will get better chances to gain organic exposure on the feed.

  • Your contributions will be prioritized in ranking algorithms, potentially leading to higher engagement and reach.

  • Reputation now plays a bigger role in establishing credibility across the platform.


Why this matters


We want daily.dev to be a place where quality contributions rise to the top. By making reputation more influential, we‚Äôre ensuring that the best insights, discussions, and knowledge get the attention they deserve.


Want to grow your reputation? Keep sharing valuable content, engaging in discussions, and contributing positively to the community.


Learn more about how reputation works here: https://docs.daily.dev/docs/your-profile/reputation
item.author: Nimrod Kramer

item.title: Advice
item.description:
Everyone has advice. Most of it is useless.


The second you start building something, people line up to tell you what to do. How to run your company. How to lead your team. How to raise money.


Here‚Äôs the problem. Most of these people have no idea what they‚Äôre talking about.


They haven‚Äôt built anything. They‚Äôve never hired a team. They‚Äôve never stared down a runway that‚Äôs running out. But they‚Äôll still tell you how to scale, how to focus, or how to lead.


It‚Äôs easy to give advice when you have nothing to lose. No skin in the game.


The truth is, most advice will slow you down.


Here‚Äôs what I‚Äôve learned about listening to ‚Äúadvice‚Äù:



  • If it sounds like a LinkedIn post or a self-help book, ignore it.

  • If they‚Äôre more focused on sounding smart than being helpful, ignore it.

  • If they‚Äôve never been where you are, ignore them. There are exceptions, but that‚Äôs for another post.


Good advice comes from people who‚Äôve been through the fire. People who get the hard calls you‚Äôre making. People who respect that you‚Äôre the one actually doing the work.


Good advice comes from those who know their zone of genius and stay in it.


Good advice comes from those with skin in the game.


The rest? Let them talk. You‚Äôve got work to do.
item.author: Nimrod Kramer

item.title: Introducing daily.dev Plus ‚úß
item.description:
You asked for more power, more control, and fewer distractions. We heard you.


daily.dev Plus is the new premium upgrade of daily.dev. It‚Äôs designed to boost your professional growth, help you learn faster, stay ahead, and cut through the noise.


Oh, and yeah‚Ä¶ you‚Äôll help us suffer less and build more (well‚Ä¶ mostly suffer less) üôè


What you‚Äôre unlocking with Plus ‚úß



  • üß† Run prompts on any post: Turn any post into an interactive learning
    experience. Ask Al to simplify concepts, challenge ideas, compare alternatives, or create your own custom prompt.

  • ü¶Ñ Advanced custom feeds: Build laser-focused feeds for the tools, languages, and topics you care about. Search less, learn more.

  • ‚ö°Ô∏è AI-powered clean titles (aka Clickbait Shield): No more misinformation. AI rewrites titles so you see the real story at a glance and dive in only when relevant.

  • ü™Ñ Organize bookmarks in folders: Easily categorize and organize your bookmarked posts into folders so you can find what you need quickly.

  • ‚úåÔ∏è Ad-free experience: Pure focus. No ads, no noise. Just the content you care about.

  • üí© Keyword filters: Mute the buzzwords you‚Äôre sick of. More signal, less noise.

  • ü§ù Members-only Squad: Join an exclusive community space to connect with other Plus members, share feedback, and get priority support.


Lock in the special rate before it‚Äôs gone


Our Annual Special Plan is built for early adopters who know a good deal when they see one. This discounted rate is the lowest we‚Äôll ever offer‚Äîand once it‚Äôs gone, it‚Äôs gone for good.


Upgrade now, and you‚Äôll lock in that sweet ‚ÄúI-was-here-first‚Äù price forever. You‚Äôll thank yourself later when you‚Äôre bragging about your grandfathered deal while everyone else is paying more.


üëâ Get started here


Hey, what about the free tier?


The free tier of daily.dev isn‚Äôt going anywhere.** It‚Äôs here to stay‚Äîforever**. You‚Äôll still get high-quality, personalized content, just like always. We‚Äôll keep making the free experience better and better. We promise :)


Still reading? Thought so‚Ä¶


If you‚Äôve read this post till the very end then you clearly love reading (respect), so we prepared some docs about Plus just for you. Who knows, you might even find your next favorite feature hidden in there.
